post_text:
Child care can be expensive, but there are resources to help!

Quality First Scholarships NOW AVAILABLE through Community Education Preschool/Prekindergarten.

Many families struggle to pay for child care. Quality child care can be costly, as providers may have the expenses of paying for more experienced teachers, keeping group sizes small, and other factors that contribute to quality. You may qualify for help. Visit https://www.dvusd.org/Page/75869 for information about Quality First Scholarships available in select Deer Valley Unified School District Preschool/Prekindergarten programs.

DVUSD is partnering with the American Red Cross to host a blood drive to help with the critically low blood supply in our state. We are asking anyone that is willing and eligible to sign up to donate! If you can't donate, please share this information with someone that can!

YOU MUST MAKE AN APPOINTMENT TO DONATE!

The Red Cross will follow all CDC guidelines, a health pre-screening is done, temperature taken at the door, all donors are spread out, and masks are given to all.

When: July 8, 2020 from 8:00-1:00
Where: Barry Goldwater High School Main Gym, 2820 W. Rose Garden Lane

Sign up at https://www.redcrossblood.org/give.html/find-drive
using the sponsor code: BGHS

post_text:
On this last day for our teachers, we want to share a sweet story from Teacher Stacy Brosius!

"Our third grade students at West Wing School read a story about the Statue of Liberty this week. We talked about how the statue is a type of monument and discussed how monuments are built to honor events or people. The students were then tasked with creating a monument to honor heroes of the pandemic."

"The picture is from one of my sweet, sweet students who is so very quiet, and she made my eyes leak! This was a lot of work for my student, who is truly one of kindest students I have ever had."

We agree with Stacy's student - Our teachers are heroes of this pandemic! #Extraordinary

post_text:
"Coping with Covid: A Public Health Approach To Your Child’s Screens -- Why Monitoring Matters And How To Build Trust Doing It"

Join us tonight at 7 p.m. for our final webinar of this school year.

PLEASE NOTE: Tonight's topic is mature in nature and is intended only for parents.

Titania Jordan, Chief Parenting Officer, joins us to share her experience of working for the nation's leading parent monitoring app and how to monitor and supervise while building trust. Titania and the staff at Bark went undercover this year posing as an 11 year old girl to showcase how easy it is for our children to be exposed to explicit content and to persons with ill intent. She will share key insights into their experiment, app, and why parents must be aware of the hidden dangers that exist in technology, while also monitoring and building trust.

For the Zoom link, visit www.dvusd.org/COVID19

post_text:
Meal Distribution Schedule Update

DVUSD will continue to provide meals to ALL children 18 and under at various locations in our District through June.

Please stay in your car and meals will be placed in the vehicle trunk, cargo space, or empty passenger seat. Child(ren) do not need to be present when picking up the meals. Verbal verification of child name and date of birth, or site pre-approval is required to assure meals are going to children.

Beginning TOMORROW - Thursday, May 21, the District will provide meals only on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Thursday meal distributions will contain 3 days of meals (Thursday, Friday and Monday), while Tuesdays will contain meals for 2 days (Tuesdays and Wednesdays).

The District may change and/or add locations or hours depending on demand. Please check www.dvusd.org/food every day to see if hours or locations change.

post_text:
Our Parenting in the Pandemic webinar series wraps up this week with our final two sessions.

TONIGHT - we will present “Raising Resilient Kids.”

Thursday - we will conclude with “Coping with COVID--Managing Screen Time for Middle School Kids.”

Both webinars begin at 7 p.m. and can be joined through the link found at www.dvusd.org/covid19.

On that web page,you can download the free “Parenting in the Pandemic” flyer to learn more detailed information about each of these upcoming webinars. To date, we have had several hundred parents join us, so check one out!

During the school closures, our parents have been unbelievably supportive and patient!

DVUSD wishes to thank all of our parents, guardians, and community members for your partnership during the past two months.

We recognize that your support is a key reason why our students and staff have been successful. Watch social media for the trending hashtag #thankaDVparent to see the many, many thanks to our parents.

In addition, Superintendent Dr. Curtis Finch has a message for you. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8iMgTZpFkB8&feature=youtu.be

Thank you for your partnership this year!

👉🏼𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐰𝐞𝐞𝐤 𝐃𝐕𝐔𝐒𝐃 𝐢𝐬 𝐭𝐚𝐤𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐜𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐛𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐞𝐚𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐟𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐬 𝐬𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐒𝐮𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭'𝐬 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟎 𝐒𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐀𝐫𝐭 𝐏𝐮𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐬𝐞 𝐀𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝👈🏻

🐯🌷Today we are celebrating the beautiful work of 𝗔𝗹𝗶𝘀𝘀𝗮 𝗢𝗿𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗮, a Sophomore student from 𝑆𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑟𝑎 𝐷𝑎𝑦 𝑂’𝐶𝑜𝑛𝑛𝑜𝑟 𝐻𝑖𝑔ℎ 𝑆𝑐ℎ𝑜𝑜𝑙 whose Charcoal Composition “𝑇𝑖𝑔𝑒𝑟” was recently selected and purchased by Superintendent Dr. Curtis Finch.

🌼Alissa’s composition, “Tiger” will now be one of four new additions put on permanent display at the District offices and added to the growing art collection at DVUSD.

🐅In her personal statement, Alissa explains that her goal for “Tiger” was to capture the “ironically fierce and beautiful creatures” that tigers are. The detail of this composition shows the success of this objective, and further proves the artistry and precision that Alissa holds.

🌳🎨🙌🏻𝑪𝒐𝒏𝒈𝒓𝒂𝒕𝒖𝒍𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏𝒔 𝒕𝒐 𝑨𝒍𝒊𝒔𝒔𝒂 𝑶𝒓𝒕𝒆𝒈𝒂 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝑨𝒓𝒕 𝑰𝒏𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒖𝒄𝒕𝒐𝒓 𝑫𝒆𝒏𝒂 𝑫𝒂𝒗𝒊𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑺𝒂𝒏𝒅𝒓𝒂 𝑫𝒂𝒚 𝑶’𝑪𝒐𝒏𝒏𝒐𝒓 𝑯𝒊𝒈𝒉 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒉𝒆𝒓 𝑪𝒉𝒂𝒓𝒄𝒐𝒂𝒍 𝒄𝒐𝒎𝒑𝒐𝒔𝒊𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 “𝑻𝒊𝒈𝒆𝒓”! 𝒀𝒐𝒖 𝒂𝒓𝒆 #𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒓𝒂𝒐𝒓𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒂𝒓𝒚! 🦋👏🏻

🌼Alissa’s composition, “Tiger” will now be one of four new additions put on permanent display at the District offices and added to the growing art collection at DVUSD.

🐅In her personal statement, Alissa explains that her goal for “Tiger” was to capture the “ironically fierce and beautiful creatures” that tigers are. The detail of this composition shows the success of this objective, and further proves the artistry and precision that Alissa holds.

🌳🎨🙌🏻𝑪𝒐𝒏𝒈𝒓𝒂𝒕𝒖𝒍𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏𝒔 𝒕𝒐 𝑨𝒍𝒊𝒔𝒔𝒂 𝑶𝒓𝒕𝒆𝒈𝒂 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝑨𝒓𝒕 𝑰𝒏𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒖𝒄𝒕𝒐𝒓 𝑫𝒆𝒏𝒂 𝑫𝒂𝒗𝒊𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑺𝒂𝒏𝒅𝒓𝒂 𝑫𝒂𝒚 𝑶’𝑪𝒐𝒏𝒏𝒐𝒓 𝑯𝒊𝒈𝒉 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒉𝒆𝒓 𝑪𝒉𝒂𝒓𝒄𝒐𝒂𝒍 𝒄𝒐𝒎𝒑𝒐𝒔𝒊𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 “𝑻𝒊𝒈𝒆𝒓”! 𝒀𝒐𝒖 𝒂𝒓𝒆 #𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒓𝒂𝒐𝒓𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒂𝒓𝒚! 🦋👏🏻

post_text:
Parenting in the Pandemic Webinar - Thursday, May 14, 7 pm

This Thursday, May 14, at 7:00 p.m. DVUSD is pleased to host our fourth social emotional webinar for our parent community. The webinar is titled “Coping with Covid: Positive Parenting Practices for Managing Screen Time and Remote Learning Challenges for High School Students.”

This session will also discuss the importance of a positive digital footprint for high school aged students. A digital footprint is the trail of data your children create while using the internet. A digital footprint can have both positive and negative consequences for students. If you have a high school or middle school aged child, you don’t want to miss out on this webinar! You can click on this Zoom link on Thursday or you can find the link by visiting www.dvusd.org/covid19.

post_text:
𝐒𝐮𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭’𝐬 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟎 𝐒𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐀𝐫𝐭 𝐏𝐮𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐬𝐞 𝐀𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬

🎨Every day this week DVUSD will be taking time to celebrate each of the five student art pieces recently selected and purchased for the Superintendent’s 2020 Student Art Purchase Awards.🏆

🌼Since 2003 the District has been purchasing student artwork for the purpose of creating a permanent and expansive art collection. Superintendent Dr. Curtis Finch examined hundreds of student art pieces at this year’s District Art Showcase, before selecting just a few for this award.

🌷𝘛𝘰𝘥𝘢𝘺 𝘸𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘩𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘭𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘰𝘧 𝘌𝘷𝘪𝘦 𝘕𝘨𝘶𝘺𝘦𝘯 - 𝘢𝘯 𝘈𝘗 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘋𝘦𝘦𝘳 𝘝𝘢𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘺 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘳𝘦𝘤𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘭𝘺 𝘴𝘦𝘭𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘳𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘨𝘯𝘪𝘻𝘦𝘥 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘢𝘸𝘢𝘳𝘥-𝘸𝘪𝘯𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘖𝘪𝘭 𝘗𝘢𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 - “𝘓𝘶𝘤𝘬.” 𝘌𝘷𝘪𝘦’𝘴 𝘱𝘢𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘳𝘦𝘤𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘭𝘺 𝘴𝘦𝘭𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘫𝘰𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘋𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵’𝘴 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳-𝘨𝘳𝘰𝘸𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘤𝘰𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘸𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘯𝘰𝘸 𝘣𝘦 𝘰𝘯 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘺 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘋𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵 𝘖𝘧𝘧𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴!

𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐥𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 to Evie Nguyen and her Art Instructor Stephanie Durham from Deer Valley Unified School District for her Oil Painting “Luck.” 🎖💐

post_text:
🌷🥳Prior to school closures, DVUSD recognized the 𝘿𝙚𝙚𝙧 𝙑𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙚𝙮 𝙃𝙞𝙜𝙝 𝙎𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡'𝙨 𝙎𝙥𝙞𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙡𝙞𝙣𝙚 for bringing home the POM title Championship from this year's 2019-20 USA Spirit Nationals Cheer Competition🌷🥳

🎖After competing against 𝟰𝟴 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺𝘀 at this year’s USA Spirit Nationals Cheer Competition, Deer Valley High School Spiritline came out victorious, taking on the Championship title and showing us the spirit of unity! 🎈🏆

🧁In order to qualify for the competition, DVHS was required to compete in several local events throughout the 2019-20 school year - further demonstrating their drive, dedication, and intense commitment to succeed!🧁

Congratulations to 2020 Varsity Show Cheer Champions!

post_text:
🥇🌷𝗦𝗺𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗲𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 – 𝗚𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗹𝗮𝗻 𝗣𝗲𝗮𝗸 𝗦𝗽𝗶𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲🌷🏆

💐Prior to school closures, DVUSD honored the Gavilan Peak High School Spiritline for bringing home the 𝐉r. 𝐇𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐒𝐦𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐒𝐡𝐨𝐰 𝐂𝐡𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐒𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐂𝐡𝐚𝐦𝐩𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐩!

⭐️Despite the many challenges Gavilan Peak Spiritline faced this year, they proved to be unstoppable. Tryouts for the team were held months later than that of other state schools, leaving them with only four months to prepare for their upcoming competition.

🎖Although the odds were stacked against them, the Gavilan Peak Spiritline team persevered and came out on top, further proving the importance of teamwork and dedication. The team's victory not only represents their ability to never give up, but it also highlights the support and encouragement of their coach Jill Minor, their Principal Chad Segersten, and their Assistant Principal Danielle Ware.

Congratulations to the Jr. High Small Show Cheer State Champions, Gavilan Peak Spiritline - YOU ARE ALL #EXTRAORDINARY!

post_text:
🥊A BIG Congratulations to this year's Girls State Wrestling Champion Bree Garcia of Barry Goldwater High School!🥳

🏋️‍♀️Two years ago, the Arizona Interscholastic Association announced that it would add girls wrestling as an emerging sport during the winter sports season. Both years produced champions from DVUSD schools including this year’s Champion, Bree Garcia🏋️

🌷💐Bree not only carries the Championship title this season - with 25 wins and only 1 loss - but she now holds the title as Barry Goldwater High School’s first female wrestling champion!🌷💐

🤼‍♀️Congratulations Bree Garcia! You are #Extraordinary

post_text:
CORRECTION - Go to www.dvusd.org/COVID19 for link to tonight's webinar!

HELPFUL PARENT WEBINARS TUESDAY & THURSDAY

As Deer Valley Unified School District continues to support our community through the COVID-19 crisis, we are proud to offer webinars parents. All parents are welcome to watch these webinars featuring national and local experts in the area of social-emotional wellness. The sessions consist of 20-minute interviews with subject matter experts and authors providing practical tips, strategies, and ideas. A Question & Answer portion will follow the presentation. More information and the webinar link is at: www.duvsd.org/COVID19.

🌷Are you looking for an #Extraordinary school for your student? Check out The Traditional Academy at Bellair opening in August 🌷

👉🏾⭐️Although DVUSD schools are currently closed, you can now enroll your child at The Traditional Academy at Bellair for the 2020-21 school year online TODAY!⭐️👈🏻

This traditional school environment will help your PreK-6th grade student thrive! The Traditional Academy at Bellair will feature back-to-basics teaching, opportunities for accelerated learning, strong behavior expectations, a focus on citizenship, and parent involvement!

🌸Anyone wishing to attend the traditional school must register and submit an open enrollment application. 🌸 To enroll, visit: https://openenrollment.dvusd.org/application and select “Bellair.”

⚡️👉🏾𝗜𝗠𝗣𝗢𝗥𝗧𝗔𝗡𝗧 𝗥𝗘𝗠𝗜𝗡𝗗𝗘𝗥 𝗙𝗢𝗥 𝗔𝗟𝗟 𝗗𝗩𝗨𝗦𝗗 𝗣𝗔𝗥𝗘𝗡𝗧𝗦 & 𝗚𝗨𝗔𝗥𝗗𝗜𝗔𝗡𝗦 👈🏻⚡️

📌 We are proud to announce that DVUSD will be hosting it’s
𝙎𝙀𝘾𝙊𝙉𝘿 Webinar in the “Parenting in the Pandemic” series: “Raising Successful People,” this Tuesday May 5 @ 7PM.

This second session will feature International Speaker and author of “Moonshots in Education” and “Raising Successful People,” Esther Wojcjcki.

𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒘𝒆 𝒘𝒊𝒍𝒍 𝒅𝒊𝒔𝒄𝒖𝒔𝒔: the future of education, current challenges facing both educators and parents, strategies on how to use this time to encourage creativity and independent learning.

✨𝙍𝙀𝙈𝙄𝙉𝘿𝙀𝙍: The series will be done in Zoom.
✨The link can be found HERE: www.dvusd.org/COVID19

Remember to look out for SESSION THREE in the series, coming Thursday!

post_text:
Congratulations 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿’𝘀 𝗔𝗿𝗶𝘇𝗼𝗻𝗮 𝗗𝗘𝗖𝗔 𝗔𝗱𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗬𝗲𝗮𝗿:
DVUSD’s Career & Technical Education Manager, Jayme Fitzpatrick

Every year, Arizona DECA holds their annual State Career Development where students compete, and participate in career development workshops.

DECA is a student organization that prepares emerging leaders and entrepreneurs in marketing, finance, hospitality and management in high schools and colleges around the globe. DVUSD DECA students continue to excel because of strong administrators who work to introduce new programs, improve existing programs and partnerships, and work to stay up on current issues so that our students can take advantage of every opportunity available.

During the General Awards Session on Saturday, DECA chapters, teachers, students and administrators were recognized for their outstanding accomplishments.

EVENT CANCELED

DVUSD announced Tuesday that all on-site school-sponsored events that involve mass gatherings are canceled through at least April 13… that includes next week’s Find Your Career Event. It is unfortunate to have to cancel, but it is a necessary step to keep our community healthy.

We are working to find a way to share the information from the wonderful community organizations and businesses who were planning to attend. Watch for future posts (perhaps a virtual way) to learn about future career options. For now, be safe and stay healthy.

There is way to stay involved! When it is safe to do so, we will set up a “virtual meet and greet” with the wonderful staff of the new Traditional Academy. To receive updates, just sign up at www.dvusd.org/TraditionalEmail. Until then, wash your hands, cover coughs, and keep your social distance!

post_text:
Dear DVUSD Families and Staff,

On Sunday March 15, Governor Ducey and State Superintendent Hoffman announced that all Arizona schools will be closed beginning March 16 through at least March 27.

According to the Governor’s Office, “Governor Ducey and Superintendent Hoffman will work with education officials and public health officials to reassess the need for the school closures and provide further guidance through March 27, 2020.”

During this time frame, DVUSD schools will be closed for ALL activities for students, including Spring Break Camp. To be clear, this means that students will not return from spring break on March 23. We know you will have questions on many items.

More information will be posted on our website Wednesday, March 18. Staff should expect email communication from the District in terms of how this closure will impact them by Wednesday, March 18 as well.
text:
Dear DVUSD Families and Staff,

On Sunday March 15, Governor Ducey and State Superintendent Hoffman announced that all Arizona schools will be closed beginning March 16 through at least March 27.

According to the Governor’s Office, “Governor Ducey and Superintendent Hoffman will work with education officials and public health officials to reassess the need for the school closures and provide further guidance through March 27, 2020.”

During this time frame, DVUSD schools will be closed for ALL activities for students, including Spring Break Camp. To be clear, this means that students will not return from spring break on March 23. We know you will have questions on many items.

More information will be posted on our website Wednesday, March 18. Staff should expect email communication from the District in terms of how this closure will impact them by Wednesday, March 18 as well.

🥳Congratulations 𝙎𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙧𝙖 𝘿𝙖𝙮 𝙊’ 𝘾𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙤𝙧, 𝙋𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙘𝙞𝙥𝙖𝙡 𝘿𝙧. 𝙇𝙮𝙣𝙣 𝙈𝙞𝙡𝙡𝙚𝙧, 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙏𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧 𝘿𝙖𝙧𝙧𝙚𝙡 𝙃𝙪𝙙𝙨𝙤𝙣 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝘾𝙞𝙫𝙞𝙘 𝙀𝙣𝙜𝙖𝙜𝙚𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙎𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡 𝙤𝙛 𝙈𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙩 𝘼𝙬𝙖𝙧𝙙🥳

👉🏾The Excellence in Civic Engagement Program was created to recognize and support the important role Arizona schools play in ensuring our students are informed and engaged citizens. The award represents the six proven practices that should be at the center of every school’s approach to civic learning.

👉🏻Tammy Waller, ADE’s Director of K-12 Social Studies & World Language, presented the Civic Engagement School of Merit award to Principal Dr. Lynn Miller, Teacher Darrell Hudson and Sandra Day O’Connor High School for the 2018-19 school year.

post_text:
Latest Letter from Superintendent Dr. Curtis Finch:

March 12, 2020

DVUSD Parents and Guardians, Deer Valley Unified School District believes the safety of our students and staff is our number one priority. Before our community goes on spring break, we want to provide you with current information about COVID-19 and our district’s actions to prevent the spread of this virus. We also want to be clear that we have not had any confirmed cases of COVID-19 within our school district. In addition, there has not been one case of COVID-19 in any school in Maricopa County. Currently, Maricopa County Department of Public Health does not recommend closing schools.

Read more at www.dvusd.org/covid19
text:

March 12, 2020

DVUSD Parents and Guardians, Deer Valley Unified School District believes the safety of our students and staff is our number one priority. Before our community goes on spring break, we want to provide you with current information about COVID-19 and our district’s actions to prevent the spread of this virus. We also want to be clear that we have not had any confirmed cases of COVID-19 within our school district. In addition, there has not been one case of COVID-19 in any school in Maricopa County. Currently, Maricopa County Department of Public Health does not recommend closing schools.

Read more at www.dvusd.org/covid19

post_text:
Congratulations to the DVUSD teachers who received Impact Grants!!🌼✨👏🏼

Each year, the Deer Valley Education Foundation (DVEF) awards Impact Grants to DVUSD teachers to directly support unique classroom projects and/or school initiatives.

This year’s DVEF Impacts Grants are funded by USAA Foundation, and will be used to impact thousands of Deer Valley students. In local communities where USAA has a significant presence of employees, they provide financial support to causes that address needs that align with the focus of their local areas.

You are all #Extraordinary 🌹🥳

post_text:
Choir Director Kirk Douglas from Boulder Creek HS 𝗟𝗢𝗩𝗘𝗦 DVUSD because...

💟 "... 𝒘𝒆 𝒄𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒂𝒃𝒐𝒖𝒕 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒈𝒊𝒗𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒎 𝒂𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒓𝒂𝒐𝒓𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒂𝒓𝒚 𝒆𝒅𝒖𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏. 𝑾𝒆 𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒕𝒆𝒂𝒄𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒉𝒐𝒘 𝒕𝒐 𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒗𝒆 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒆𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒃𝒚 𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒐𝒖𝒓𝒂𝒈𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒎 𝒕𝒐 𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒇𝒐𝒓𝒎 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒊𝒓 𝒃𝒆𝒔𝒕 𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒓𝒚𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒚 𝒅𝒐!" 💟
text:
Choir Director Kirk Douglas from Boulder Creek HS 𝗟𝗢𝗩𝗘𝗦 DVUSD because...

💟 "... 𝒘𝒆 𝒄𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒂𝒃𝒐𝒖𝒕 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒈𝒊𝒗𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒎 𝒂𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒓𝒂𝒐𝒓𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒂𝒓𝒚 𝒆𝒅𝒖𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏. 𝑾𝒆 𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒕𝒆𝒂𝒄𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒉𝒐𝒘 𝒕𝒐 𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒗𝒆 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒆𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒃𝒚 𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒐𝒖𝒓𝒂𝒈𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒎 𝒕𝒐 𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒇𝒐𝒓𝒎 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒊𝒓 𝒃𝒆𝒔𝒕 𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒓𝒚𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒚 𝒅𝒐!" 💟

post_text:
This Valentines Day we are sharing some of the many reasons why "we love DVUSD."

💟 𝙒𝙚 𝙇𝙊𝙑𝙀 𝘿𝙑𝙐𝙎𝘿 𝙗𝙚𝙘𝙖𝙪𝙨𝙚....

"𝘐 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘢𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘣𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭. 𝘔𝘺 𝘤𝘰𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘦𝘳𝘴 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘥-𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨, 𝘧𝘶𝘯𝘯𝘺, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘮𝘢𝘻𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘯𝘥. 𝘞𝘦 𝘵𝘳𝘶𝘭𝘺 𝘭𝘰𝘷𝘦 𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳. 𝘛𝘩𝘦𝘺 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘧𝘦𝘦𝘭 𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘺." - Andrea Koehnke, Teacher @ Desert Sky

💟 𝙒𝙚 𝙇𝙊𝙑𝙀 𝘿𝙑𝙐𝙎𝘿 𝙗𝙚𝙘𝙖𝙪𝙨𝙚....

"𝘞𝘦 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘫𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘭𝘪𝘬𝘦 𝘢 𝘣𝘪𝘨 𝘧𝘢𝘮𝘪𝘭𝘺 𝘴𝘩𝘰𝘶𝘭𝘥 𝘥𝘰 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳. 𝘞𝘦 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘫𝘰𝘣 𝘥𝘰𝘯𝘦!" -Mark Lazok, Crossing Guard @ Mirage Elementary
text:
This Valentines Day we are sharing some of the many reasons why "we love DVUSD."

💟 𝙒𝙚 𝙇𝙊𝙑𝙀 𝘿𝙑𝙐𝙎𝘿 𝙗𝙚𝙘𝙖𝙪𝙨𝙚....

"𝘐 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘢𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘣𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭. 𝘔𝘺 𝘤𝘰𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘦𝘳𝘴 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘥-𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨, 𝘧𝘶𝘯𝘯𝘺, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘮𝘢𝘻𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘯𝘥. 𝘞𝘦 𝘵𝘳𝘶𝘭𝘺 𝘭𝘰𝘷𝘦 𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳. 𝘛𝘩𝘦𝘺 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘧𝘦𝘦𝘭 𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘺." - Andrea Koehnke, Teacher @ Desert Sky

💟 𝙒𝙚 𝙇𝙊𝙑𝙀 𝘿𝙑𝙐𝙎𝘿 𝙗𝙚𝙘𝙖𝙪𝙨𝙚....

"𝘞𝘦 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘫𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘭𝘪𝘬𝘦 𝘢 𝘣𝘪𝘨 𝘧𝘢𝘮𝘪𝘭𝘺 𝘴𝘩𝘰𝘶𝘭𝘥 𝘥𝘰 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳. 𝘞𝘦 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘫𝘰𝘣 𝘥𝘰𝘯𝘦!" -Mark Lazok, Crossing Guard @ Mirage Elementary

post_text:
💟This Valentines Day we are celebrating all the reasons why we 𝙇𝙊𝙑𝙀 DVUSD💟

"Even though I am new to the community, I feel very much welcomed and supported by my colleagues and admin. The teachers are awesome, and they are very serious with their calling to teach - it's infectious and I am happy to absorb all the positive energy that I feel each time I show up to work."
- 𝙈𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙖 𝙌𝙪𝙞𝙣𝙩𝙤, 𝙎𝙥𝙚𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙀𝙙𝙪𝙘𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙍𝙚𝙨𝙤𝙪𝙧𝙘𝙚 𝙏𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧

post_text:
💥🥳Wow! This past month has been pretty amazing! DVUSD thanks everyone who participated and helped us "Raise the bar of #Extraordinary" during Board Member Recognition Month and the celebration of our 𝘾𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙑𝙖𝙡𝙪𝙚𝙨!

As we finish off the week, I hope to continue to highlight the importance of DVUSD's fifth Core Value: Excellence.

𝘚𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘶𝘴 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘰𝘶𝘨𝘩𝘵𝘴 𝘰𝘯 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘵 𝘮𝘦𝘢𝘯𝘴 𝘵𝘰 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 '𝘌𝘹𝘤𝘦𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦' 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘤𝘩𝘦𝘤𝘬 𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘋𝘝𝘜𝘚𝘋’𝘴 ‘𝘊𝘰𝘳𝘦 𝘝𝘢𝘭𝘶𝘦’ 𝘝𝘪𝘥𝘦𝘰 𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦: https://www.dvusd.org/Page/6023

ＤＶＵＳＤ　ＣＯＲＥ　ＶＡＬＵＥＳ：
🌷𝑹𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒕: We treat each other with dignity.
🌻𝑨𝒄𝒄𝒐𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒃𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒕𝒚: We fulfill our commitments.
💐𝑰𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒈𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒚:We are honest and ethical.
🌼𝑺𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝑫𝒓𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒏: We put students first.
🌷𝑬𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆: We strive to be extraordinary.

🙌🌸This week, during our continuation of DVUSD's Core Value recognition month, we have been celebrating 'Excellence.'💐🌼

"𝗜 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝗲𝘅𝗰𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗯𝘆 𝗽𝘂𝘁𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗺𝘆 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗱𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗜 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗼 𝗱𝗼 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗹𝘄𝗮𝘆𝘀 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗹𝘆 𝘁𝗼 𝗺𝘆 𝟭𝟬𝟬%."
-𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘶𝘦𝘭 𝘏𝘶𝘳𝘵𝘢𝘥𝘰, 𝘚𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵

✌🏽🌻How do you show Excellence? 👈🏾🌷

Share with us your thoughts on DVUSD's Core Values, and learn more about the impact and significance of all five of our Core Values here: https://www.dvusd.org/Page/6023

post_text:
👉🏽This week, DVUSD is celebrating '𝐄𝐱𝐜𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞' as part Core Value recognition month.

🥳In honor of this celebration, DVUSD has created a video dedicated to highlighting the significance of each Core Value. What does 'Excellence' mean to you?

"𝘐 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘬 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘵’𝘴 𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘸𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘦𝘹𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘰𝘳𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘢𝘳𝘺, 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵, 𝘐 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘬 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘸𝘦’𝘳𝘦 𝘤𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘦𝘹𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘰𝘳𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘢𝘳𝘺 𝘱𝘦𝘰𝘱𝘭𝘦, 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘰 𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘱𝘶𝘴𝘩 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘦𝘯𝘷𝘦𝘭𝘰𝘱𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘸𝘦 𝘵𝘰𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘯𝘦𝘹𝘵 𝘭𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘭."
-𝘾𝙝𝙧𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙚 𝙃𝙚𝙣𝙧𝙮, 𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙢𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙈𝙚𝙢𝙗𝙚𝙧 & 𝙋𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩 🖍📚

👏🏽In DVUSD's 'Core Value' video (linked below) we delved deep into the meaning and significance of all five Core Values - check it out: https://vimeo.com/347363495

post_text:
🌻𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰𝘁 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬🌻

- 𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝘿𝙧. 𝘾𝙪𝙧𝙩𝙞𝙨 𝙁𝙞𝙣𝙘𝙝 𝙝𝙖𝙨 𝙧𝙚𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙨𝙚𝙙 𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙎𝙩𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙤𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝘿𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙩 2020 -

The State of the District summary not only mirrors the State of the State and the State of the Union addresses in reflection and visioning, but it is also used as an accountability mechanism for DVUSD moving into the future.

The design of the document is to remind us of our singular path, communicate any directional modifications to our Strategic Plan, and reinforce our district Core Values, Mission and Vision.

As we step into 2020, it is a perfect time to come with fresh eyes and reevaluate the progress made with successfully executing the Strategic Plan, which covers the completion and beginning of two separate school years.

To read more, go to: 𝘄𝘄𝘄.𝗱𝘃𝘂𝘀𝗱.𝗼𝗿𝗴/𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗼𝗳𝗗𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰𝘁

text:
🌻𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰𝘁 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬🌻

- 𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝘿𝙧. 𝘾𝙪𝙧𝙩𝙞𝙨 𝙁𝙞𝙣𝙘𝙝 𝙝𝙖𝙨 𝙧𝙚𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙨𝙚𝙙 𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙎𝙩𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙤𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝘿𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙩 2020 -

The State of the District summary not only mirrors the State of the State and the State of the Union addresses in reflection and visioning, but it is also used as an accountability mechanism for DVUSD moving into the future.

The design of the document is to remind us of our singular path, communicate any directional modifications to our Strategic Plan, and reinforce our district Core Values, Mission and Vision.

As we step into 2020, it is a perfect time to come with fresh eyes and reevaluate the progress made with successfully executing the Strategic Plan, which covers the completion and beginning of two separate school years.

To read more, go to: 𝘄𝘄𝘄.𝗱𝘃𝘂𝘀𝗱.𝗼𝗿𝗴/𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗼𝗳𝗗𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰𝘁

DVUSD.ORG
Superintendent / State of the DVUSD 2020

post_text:
DVUSD will host another Community Conversation centered on the topic of suicide awareness and social and emotional learning. Led by nationally known expert Dr. Max McGee and his group of presenters, members of our school community can expect an informative and lively presentation about a wide range of issues that students in our society face today. The presentation will be followed by a question and answer period with Dr. McGee, his presenters, and DVUSD district administrators.

Join us Wednesday, February 5th 7:00 to 8:00 p.m. at Sandra Day O'Connor High School Performing Arts Building 25250 N 35th Avenue, Phoenix
Q&A will follow the Presentation.

post_text:
🥳🙌🏽 DVUSD defines 'EXCELLENCE' as: "𝐖𝐞 𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐛𝐞 #𝐄𝐱𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐨𝐫𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐫𝐲"💐🌻

For the past month we have been celebrating each of the five DVUSD Core Values. This week it's all about Core Value No. five - "Excellence."

"𝙎𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙥𝙪𝙨𝙝𝙚𝙨 𝙢𝙚 𝙩𝙤𝙬𝙖𝙧𝙙𝙨 𝙗𝙚𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙚𝙭𝙩𝙧𝙖𝙤𝙧𝙙𝙞𝙣𝙖𝙧𝙮 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙚𝙭𝙘𝙚𝙡𝙡𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙞𝙨 𝙨𝙚𝙚𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙢𝙮 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧’𝙨 𝙥𝙖𝙨𝙨𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙩𝙤𝙬𝙖𝙧𝙙𝙨 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜."
- 𝘈𝘥𝘪𝘵𝘪 𝘎𝘢𝘭𝘢𝘯𝘥𝘦, 𝘚𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵

Help us "Strive to be #Extraordinary" and share with us what Excellence means to you. Also, check out DVUSD's video on the impact of the five Core Values: https://vimeo.com/347363495

post_text:
✌🏽🌻Help us "Raise the bar of #Extraordinary" while we continue to celebrate each of DVUSD's Core Values🌻✌🏽

"..𝐈 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐤 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐃𝐕𝐔𝐒𝐃 𝐡𝐚𝐬 𝐚 𝐥𝐨𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐨𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐢𝐫 𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐝𝐫𝐚𝐰. 𝐈’𝐯𝐞 𝐭𝐚𝐥𝐤𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐰𝐡𝐨’𝐯𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐢𝐫 𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐫𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐦𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐨𝐧𝐥𝐲 𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐝𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐭. 𝐀𝐧𝐝 𝐈 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐤 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐬𝐚𝐲𝐬 𝐚 𝐥𝐨𝐭."
- 𝘊𝘩𝘳𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘦 𝘏𝘦𝘯𝘳𝘺, 𝘊𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘔𝘦𝘮𝘣𝘦𝘳 & 𝘗𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘯𝘵👈🏾

In DVUSD's 'Core Value' video (linked below) we delved deep into the meaning and significance of each Core Value - check it out: https://vimeo.com/347363495

DVUSD CORE VALUES:
💐𝑹𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒕: We treat each other with dignity.
🌷𝑨𝒄𝒄𝒐𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒃𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒕𝒚: We fulfill our commitments.
🌼𝑰𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒈𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒚:We are honest and ethical.
🎍𝑺𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝑫𝒓𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒏: We put students first.
🌻𝑬𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆: We strive to be extraordinary.

- 𝘊𝘩𝘳𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘦 𝘏𝘦𝘯𝘳𝘺, 𝘊𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘔𝘦𝘮𝘣𝘦𝘳 & 𝘗𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘯𝘵👈🏾

🌻𝑬𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆: We strive to be extraordinary.

post_text:
👉🏽This week, DVUSD is celebrating 'Student Driven' as part of 'Core Value' recognition month! To be 'Student-Driven' means to "put students first."

🥳In honor of this celebration, DVUSD has created a video dedicated to highlighting the importance, impact, and significance of each Core Value.🎈

"𝘼𝙨 𝙖 𝙨𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙝𝙚𝙧𝙚 𝙞𝙣 𝘿𝙚𝙚𝙧 𝙑𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙚𝙮, 𝙄 𝙖𝙗𝙨𝙤𝙡𝙪𝙩𝙚𝙡𝙮 𝙛𝙚𝙡𝙩 𝙖 𝙨𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩-𝙘𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙙 𝙛𝙤𝙘𝙪𝙨. 𝙄 𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙧𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙙𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙩 𝙞𝙣 𝙨𝙞𝙭𝙩𝙝-𝙜𝙧𝙖𝙙𝙚 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙛𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙢𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙞𝙣 𝙈𝙧𝙨. 𝘽𝙖𝙪𝙢’𝙨 𝙘𝙡𝙖𝙨𝙨 𝙖𝙩 𝙑𝙞𝙡𝙡𝙖𝙜𝙚 𝙈𝙚𝙖𝙙𝙤𝙬𝙨 𝙄 𝙝𝙖𝙙 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙙 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙢𝙚 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙢𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙗𝙚 𝙨𝙪𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙛𝙪𝙡."
-𝘉𝘳𝘪𝘵𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘺 𝘚𝘶𝘵𝘵𝘰𝘯, 𝘗𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘤𝘪𝘱𝘢𝘭 🖍📚

👏🏽Share with us your thoughts on what it means to be 'Student Driven' and check out DVUSD’s ‘Core Value’ Video here: https://www.dvusd.org/Page/6023

text:
TONIGHT'S THE NIGHT for Kindergarten Preview Night at ALL DVUSD K-6 and K-8 Schools!***

Meet our #Extraordinary teachers, tour classrooms,
and learn how your child will succeed in
our Kindergarten Program!
TONIGHT, January 30, 2020 at 5:30 - 7 p.m.
Event takes place at all K-6 & K-8 schools

Visit www.dvusd.org/kindergarten to learn more about the program, enrollment, and our #Extraordinary DVUSD Schools!

***The new Elementary #31 in the Union Park Neighborhood will hold events in the near future. Find out more at www.dvusd.org/Elementary31

Every Tuesday throughout the month of January will be devoted to celebrating our devoted School Board Members for 'School Board Appreciation Month.'

Take a moment today to share your appreciation for your Governing Board Members, and let them know that their dedicated service is recognized and immensely appreciated.🌷

post_text:
🥳🙌🏽 𝘿𝙑𝙐𝙎𝘿 𝙙𝙚𝙛𝙞𝙣𝙚𝙨 '𝙎𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝘿𝙧𝙞𝙫𝙚𝙣' 𝙖𝙨: "𝙬𝙚 𝙥𝙪𝙩 𝙨𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝙁𝙄𝙍𝙎𝙏."💐🌻

This month, DVUSD will be taking time to celebrate each of the five Core Values and to highlight their impact and influence in our community!

"𝘗𝘶𝘵𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘧𝘪𝘳𝘴𝘵 𝘮𝘦𝘢𝘯𝘴 𝘬𝘯𝘰𝘸𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘶𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘮𝘺 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴’ 𝘯𝘦𝘦𝘥𝘴. 𝘐𝘵 𝘪𝘴 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘫𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘢 𝘣𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘦, 𝘣𝘶𝘵 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘢 𝘣𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘦𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯, 𝘤𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦-𝘭𝘰𝘯𝘨 𝘱𝘢𝘴𝘴𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨."
- 𝙈𝙖𝙧𝙮 𝘼𝙣𝙣 𝘾𝙖𝙬𝙡𝙚𝙮, 𝙏𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧

Help us "Raise the bar of #Extraordinary" and check out DVUSD's video on the impact of our five Core Values!
https://vimeo.com/347363495

"𝘗𝘶𝘵𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘧𝘪𝘳𝘴𝘵 𝘮𝘦𝘢𝘯𝘴 𝘬𝘯𝘰𝘸𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘶𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘮𝘺 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴’ 𝘯𝘦𝘦𝘥𝘴. 𝘐𝘵 𝘪𝘴 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘫𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘢 𝘣𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘦, 𝘣𝘶𝘵 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘢 𝘣𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘦𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯, 𝘤𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦-𝘭𝘰𝘯𝘨 𝘱𝘢𝘴𝘴𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨."
- 𝙈𝙖𝙧𝙮 𝘼𝙣𝙣 𝘾𝙖𝙬𝙡𝙚𝙮, 𝙏𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧

Help us "Raise the bar of #Extraordinary" and check out DVUSD's video on the impact of our five Core Values!
https://vimeo.com/347363495

post_text:
🤩⭐️👉🏽This week, as we finish up our focus of DVUSD's third Core Value: Ｉｎｔｅｇｒｉｔｙ, we hope to hear more about what Integrity means to you!

🌷DVUSD defines Integrity as "𝘸𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘩𝘰𝘯𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘭."🌷

"𝙄 𝙨𝙚𝙚 𝙞𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙜𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙖𝙩 𝙨𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡 𝙬𝙝𝙚𝙣 𝙨𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙜𝙚𝙩𝙨 𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙗𝙡𝙚...𝙁𝙤𝙧 𝙞𝙣𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙚, 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙮 𝙩𝙚𝙡𝙡 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧: "𝙄’𝙢 𝙨𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙮 - 𝙄 𝙙𝙞𝙙 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨". 𝙉𝙤 𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙧 𝙬𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙝𝙖𝙥𝙥𝙚𝙣𝙨 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙖𝙡𝙬𝙖𝙮𝙨 𝙩𝙚𝙡𝙡 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙩𝙧𝙪𝙩𝙝."
-Manny Hurtado, Student ✌🏽

Help us "Raise the bar of #Extraordinary" and check out DVUSD's video on the impact of our five Core Values!
https://vimeo.com/347363495

post_text:
🌻This week is all about Integrity! To live with Integrity means to be "honest and ethical." 🌻

"There was an instance on campus where we were taking a math test, and the math teacher had to step out for a minute...There were no adults in the classroom. There was no staff, no teachers. It was just students, and while he was gone, none of the students felt the urge to take out their phones to cheat or whisper and talk about answers. We all felt like we had a commitment and responsibility to have integrity and be responsible for our actions."
-Aditi Galande, Student

Help us "Raise the bar of #Extraordinary" and tell us what it means to have integrity!

ＤＶＵＳＤ　ＣＯＲＥ　ＶＡＬＵＥＳ：
⭐️𝑹𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒕: We treat each other with dignity.
⭐️𝑨𝒄𝒄𝒐𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒃𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒕𝒚: We fulfill our commitments.
⭐️𝑰𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒈𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒚:We are honest and ethical.
⭐️𝑺𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝑫𝒓𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒏: We put students first.
⭐️𝑬𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆: We strive to be extraordinary.

2020-2021 Budget Committee Seeking Input

PROVIDE FEEDBACK BY MIDNIGHT TONIGHT.

The 20-21 Budget Committee needs your input to establish budget priorities for the upcoming school year. Please take a moment to complete this survey:
https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/5Q7SBCK

The committee will review your input and develop a list of budget priorities that will come back to you in February in a second survey allowing you to rank the priorities. Please complete the first survey by January 21, 2020, to have your input included.

post_text:
Every 𝓣𝓾𝓮𝓼𝓭𝓪𝔂 during 'ꜱᴄʜᴏᴏʟ ʙᴏᴀʀᴅ ᴀᴘᴘʀᴇᴄɪᴀᴛɪᴏɴ ᴍᴏɴᴛʜ,' we will be taking time to celebrate the dedicated services of our School Board Members!

✏️ 🌷Board members shoulder critical responsibilities, advocating for public education while maintaining the needs of the school district. School board membrs not only work closely with parents and other community members to create the scholastic vision that is hoped for - but they also dedicate themselves to students and believe* that all children can be successful learners.🌻

💥𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀 = 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀
𝗧𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗸 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗯𝗼𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆!🔥

Be sure to take time today to show gratitude for our governing board members today, and all of their effort, support, and devotion to our communities!
text:
Every 𝓣𝓾𝓮𝓼𝓭𝓪𝔂 during 'ꜱᴄʜᴏᴏʟ ʙᴏᴀʀᴅ ᴀᴘᴘʀᴇᴄɪᴀᴛɪᴏɴ ᴍᴏɴᴛʜ,' we will be taking time to celebrate the dedicated services of our School Board Members!

✏️ 🌷Board members shoulder critical responsibilities, advocating for public education while maintaining the needs of the school district. School board membrs not only work closely with parents and other community members to create the scholastic vision that is hoped for - but they also dedicate themselves to students and believe* that all children can be successful learners.🌻

💥𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀 = 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀
𝗧𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗸 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗯𝗼𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆!🔥

Be sure to take time today to show gratitude for our governing board members today, and all of their effort, support, and devotion to our communities!

✨As part of this month’s recognition of the five 𝐂𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐕𝐚𝐥𝐮𝐞𝐬, this week we are highlighting ‘Integrity.’ So far, DVUSD has celebrated the meaning and importance of ‘Respect’ and ‘Accountability,’ both of which play integral roles in our development and growth as a community.

🌷ᴅᴠᴜꜱᴅ ᴅᴇꜰɪɴᴇꜱ ɪɴᴛᴇɢʀɪᴛʏ ᴀꜱ: ᴡᴇ ᴀʀᴇ ʜᴏɴᴇꜱᴛ ᴀɴᴅ ᴇᴛʜɪᴄᴀʟ🌻

Courtney Koshar, a parent of DVUSD, says:
“𝑰 𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒌 𝒊𝒕’𝒔 𝒄𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒍 𝒕𝒐 𝒉𝒂𝒗𝒆 𝑫𝒆𝒆𝒓 𝑽𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 𝑫𝒊𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒄𝒕 𝒃𝒆 𝒂𝒏 𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒍 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒉𝒐𝒏𝒆𝒔𝒕 𝒐𝒓𝒈𝒂𝒏𝒊𝒛𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 𝒃𝒆𝒄𝒂𝒖𝒔𝒆 𝒘𝒆 𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒓𝒖𝒔𝒕𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒌𝒊𝒅𝒔 𝒍𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒊𝒓 𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒓𝒆 𝒔𝒐𝒄𝒊𝒂𝒍 𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒖𝒄𝒕𝒖𝒓𝒆 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒂 𝒎𝒂𝒋𝒐𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝒐𝒇 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆 𝒅𝒖𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒅𝒂𝒚.”

👉🏽Share with us your thoughts on ‘Integrity,’ and check out DVUSD’s ‘Core Value’ Video here: https://www.dvusd.org/Page/6023

post_text:
🔥In order to "𝚁𝚊𝚒𝚜𝚎 𝚝𝚑𝚎 𝚋𝚊𝚛 𝚘𝚏 #𝙴𝚡𝚝𝚛𝚊𝚘𝚛𝚍𝚒𝚗𝚊𝚛𝚢," we must remain accountable!🔥

This week DVUSD is celebrating 'Accountability' as part of our Core Values recognition month. What does Accountability mean to you?

"ɪ ꜰᴇᴇʟ ᴀᴄᴄᴏᴜɴᴛᴀʙɪʟɪᴛʏ ɪꜱ ᴀ ᴘʀᴏᴍɪꜱᴇ ᴛʜᴀᴛ ɪ ᴍᴀᴋᴇ...ᴇᴠᴇʀ ꜱɪɴᴄᴇ ɪ ʙᴇᴄᴀᴍᴇ ᴀ ᴛᴇᴀᴄʜᴇʀ, ɪ ʜᴀᴠᴇ ᴛʜᴀᴛ ᴄᴏᴍᴍɪᴛᴍᴇɴᴛ ᴏꜰ ꜱᴇʀᴠɪᴄᴇ ᴛᴏ ᴍʏ ꜱᴛᴜᴅᴇɴᴛꜱ." -𝙈𝙖𝙧𝙮 𝘼𝙣𝙣 𝘾𝙖𝙬𝙡𝙚𝙮, 𝙏𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧

ＤＶＵＳＤ　ＣＯＲＥ　ＶＡＬＵＥＳ：
🌻𝑹𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒕: We treat each other with dignity.
🌸𝑨𝒄𝒄𝒐𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒃𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒕𝒚: We fulfill our commitments.
🌼𝑰𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒈𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒚:We are honest and ethical.
🌷𝑺𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝑫𝒓𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒏: We put students first.
💐𝑬𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆: We strive to be extraordinary.

Share with us your thoughts on Accountability, and check out DVUSD's 'Core Value' Video: https://www.dvusd.org/Page/6023

post_text:
Each of DVUSD’s Core Values play an essential role in “𝐑𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐫 𝐨𝐟 #𝐄𝐱𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐨𝐫𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐫𝐲.” To be accountable means to “fulfill our commitments.”

✨🌻This week as we continue to celebrate Accountability, we hope to highlight the importance and impact of this Core Value in our community!🚀🌼

“ɪ ᴛʜɪɴᴋ ᴛʜᴇ ᴅɪꜱᴛʀɪᴄᴛ’ꜱ ᴘʀᴏᴍɪꜱᴇ ᴛᴏ ᴛʜᴇ ᴄᴏᴍᴍᴜɴɪᴛʏ ɪꜱ ᴛʜᴀᴛ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡɪʟʟ ʀᴀɪꜱᴇ ʟɪꜰᴇ-ʟᴏɴɢ ʟᴇᴀʀɴᴇʀꜱ ᴡʜᴏ ᴡɪʟʟ ɢᴏ ᴏᴜᴛ ᴛʜᴇʀᴇ ᴀɴᴅ ɴᴏᴛ ᴊᴜꜱᴛ ꜰɪɴᴅ ᴀ ᴄᴀʀᴇᴇʀ ʙᴜᴛ ᴛᴀᴋᴇ ᴄᴀʀᴇ ᴏꜰ ᴛʜᴇɪʀ ᴏᴡɴ ᴄᴏᴍᴍᴜɴɪᴛɪᴇꜱ.” -𝘾𝙝𝙧𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙚 𝙃𝙚𝙣𝙧𝙮, 𝙋𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩 🖍

ＤＶＵＳＤ　ＣＯＲＥ　ＶＡＬＵＥＳ：
🌷𝑹𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒕: We treat each other with dignity.
🌻𝑨𝒄𝒄𝒐𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒃𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒕𝒚: We fulfill our commitments.
🌸𝑰𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒈𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒚:We are honest and ethical.
💐𝑺𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝑫𝒓𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒏: We put students first.
🌼𝑬𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆: We strive to be extraordinary.

Share with us your thoughts on accountability, and check out DVUSD's 'Core Value' Video: https://www.dvusd.org/Page/6023

post_text:
👉🏽In honor of '𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐁𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐝 𝐀𝐩𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐌𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐡,' every Tuesday in January will be designated to celebrate and honor the dedicated services of our school board members!

🌼Not only do our board members serve as a link between that of the community and classroom, they also use their position to establish the policies that provide a safe and ever-evolving framework for public schools.🌷

Be sure to take time today to show gratitude for our governing board members, and all of their sustained effort, support, and devotion to our communities!

⚡️🚀𝕊𝕖𝕣𝕧𝕚𝕟𝕘 𝕠𝕦𝕣 𝕜𝕚𝕕𝕤 𝕒𝕟𝕕 𝕔𝕠𝕞𝕞𝕦𝕟𝕚𝕥𝕪

post_text:
🥳🙌🏽This month, DVUSD will be taking time to celebrate each of the five core values and to highlight their impact and influence in our community.💐🌻

This week we are focusing on "𝓐𝓬𝓬𝓸𝓾𝓷𝓽𝓪𝓫𝓲𝓵𝓲𝓽𝔂," which DVUSD defines as: we fulfill our commitments.

"𝘼𝙘𝙘𝙤𝙪𝙣𝙩𝙖𝙗𝙞𝙡𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙞𝙨𝙣’𝙩 𝙟𝙪𝙨𝙩 𝙜𝙚𝙩𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙥𝙚𝙤𝙥𝙡𝙚 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝, 𝙞𝙩’𝙨 𝙝𝙤𝙡𝙙𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙢 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙖𝙧𝙙 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙜𝙚𝙩𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙤𝙨𝙚 𝙠𝙞𝙙𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙠𝙞𝙡𝙡𝙨 𝙨𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙮 𝙘𝙖𝙣 𝙗𝙚 𝙨𝙪𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙛𝙪𝙡 𝙖𝙛𝙩𝙚𝙧 𝙝𝙞𝙜𝙝 𝙨𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡. 𝙄𝙩’𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙩 𝙜𝙞𝙫𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙪𝙥 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙞𝙩’𝙨 𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙤𝙜𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙧." -Brittany Sutton

ＤＶＵＳＤ　ＣＯＲＥ　ＶＡＬＵＥＳ：
⭐️𝑹𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒕: We treat each other with dignity.
⭐️𝑨𝒄𝒄𝒐𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒃𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒕𝒚: We fulfill our commitments.
⭐️𝑰𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒈𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒚:We are honest and ethical.
⭐️𝑺𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝑫𝒓𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒏: We put students first.
⭐️𝑬𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆: We strive to be extraordinary.

To learn more about DVUSD's 'Core Values' check out the video below, or go to: https://www.dvusd.org/Page/6023

post_text:
In order to "Raise the bar of #Extraordinary," we must 'Respect' not only ourselves, but others too.

💐🌹"𝑨𝒔 𝒂 𝒕𝒆𝒂𝒄𝒉𝒆𝒓, 𝒓𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒎𝒆𝒂𝒏𝒔 𝒉𝒐𝒏𝒐𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒐𝒏𝒆𝒔 𝒗𝒂𝒍𝒖𝒆, 𝒓𝒆𝒄𝒐𝒈𝒏𝒊𝒛𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒓𝒚 𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒗𝒊𝒅𝒖𝒂𝒍 𝒎𝒆𝒎𝒃𝒆𝒓 𝒐𝒇 𝒚𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒔𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 𝒄𝒐𝒎𝒎𝒖𝒏𝒊𝒕𝒚, 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒊𝒓 𝒔𝒌𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒄𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒃𝒖𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏𝒔." -Mary Ann Cawley

🌟As we continue recognizing each of DVUSD's five 'Core Values', we also hope to highlight the meaning and significance behind each one. To 'Respect' someone, means 𝒕𝒐 𝒕𝒓𝒆𝒂𝒕 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒎 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝒅𝒊𝒈𝒏𝒊𝒕𝒚.

To learn more about DVUSD's 'Core Values' watch our 'Core Values' VIDEO: https://vimeo.com/347363495

post_text:
This week we are highlighting '𝑹𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒕' as part of DVUSD's continued recognition of the five 'Core Values.'

💐🌻"𝙄 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙠 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙤𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙖𝙡𝙡, 𝘿𝙚𝙚𝙧 𝙑𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙚𝙮 𝙨𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡 𝙙𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙩 𝙙𝙤𝙚𝙨 𝙖 𝙜𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙩 𝙟𝙤𝙗 𝙤𝙛 𝙞𝙣𝙨𝙩𝙞𝙡𝙡𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙧𝙚𝙨𝙥𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙥𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝙗𝙤𝙩𝙝 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧𝙨." -Courtney Koshar, Parent

ＣＯＲＥ　ＶＡＬＵＥＳ
⭐️𝓡𝓮𝓼𝓹𝓮𝓬𝓽: We treat each other with dignity.
⭐️𝓐𝓬𝓬𝓸𝓾𝓷𝓽𝓪𝓫𝓲𝓵𝓲𝓽𝔂: We fulfill our commitments.
⭐️𝓘𝓷𝓽𝓮𝓰𝓻𝓲𝓽𝔂: We are honest and ethical.
⭐️𝓢𝓽𝓾𝓭𝓮𝓷𝓽 𝓓𝓻𝓲𝓿𝓮𝓷: We put students first.
⭐️𝓔𝔁𝓬𝓮𝓵𝓵𝓮𝓷𝓬𝓮: We strive to be extraordinary

To watch DVUSD's video on the five Core Values, go to: https://vimeo.com/347363495

post_text:
During this month we will celebrate each of DVUSD's core values. Not only do our core values allow for us to 'Raise the bar of #Extraordinary,' but it has also paved the way for success and perseverance within our community.

𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗲𝗲𝗸 𝘄𝗲 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 the core value of '𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝘁.'

DVUSD defines Respect as: We treat each other with dignity

ＤＶＵＳＤ　ＣＯＲＥ　ＶＡＬＵＥＳ：
𝑹𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒕: We treat each other with dignity.
𝑨𝒄𝒄𝒐𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒃𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒕𝒚: We fulfill our commitments.
𝑰𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒈𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒚:We are honest and ethical.
𝑺𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝑫𝒓𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒏: We put students first.
𝑬𝒙𝒄𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆: We strive to be extraordinary.

Share with us your thoughts on respect, and check out DVUSD's 'Core Value' Video: https://www.dvusd.org/Page/6023

post_text:
Reservations now open for Barry Goldwater's student-run, fine dining restaurant ＡＶＥＮＵＥ ２７- for Winter/Spring 2020

Unfortunately ＡＶＥＮＵＥ ２７ – is 𝙁𝙐𝙇𝙇𝙔 𝘽𝙊𝙊𝙆𝙀𝘿 for Friday, January 10.

𝗜𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂'𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗶𝗿 next 𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗶𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝗝𝗮𝗻𝘂𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝟯𝟭, 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝗽𝗹𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗲𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗹: 𝗔𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘂𝗲𝟮𝟳@𝗱𝘃𝘂𝘀𝗱.𝗼𝗿𝗴
Visit www.dvusd.org/Avenue27 for the full list of dates the restaurant will be open!

The January menu looks delicious! See attached!

🥪🥖Avenue 27 is dedicated to serving the highest quality, thoughtfully crafted food in an upscale yet comfortable atmosphere. Experience their amazing a la carte dining experience and give your taste buds the excitement they long for!🥗🥘
Please join us and enjoy some amazing food and service by our #Extraordinary Culinary Arts students!

post_text:
In recognition of the dedicated services of our school board members, January has been designated as School Board Appreciation Month! 🥳

This is the time to show our appreciation and to increase our understanding of how our Governing Board members work together to provide a better future for our children. Please join us in celebrating, recognizing, and commending all our Board Members who volunteer their time to help make our schools #Extraordinary.

✨Look out as we continue to recognize our Governing Board Members throughout the month of January! ✨

post_text:
Who wants free books?

The Deer Valley Unified School District invites your child to join the Big Kid Book Club! All children between the ages of 3-5, who are not yet attending in kindergarten, are eligible to join the Big Kid Book Club.

By signing up, we will send your child a free book in the mail several times a year, along with helpful advice for parents of 3-5 year olds.

JOIN NOW AT THIS LINK:
https://dvusd.wufoo.com/forms/big-kid-book-club/

Let us help your child cultivate a love for reading – and get ready for kindergarten. You do not need to live within the Deer Valley Unified School District to participate.

post_text:
✨🤩🥳Wow! This year 14 DVUSD teachers won the "Wishes for Teachers" Fiesta Bowl Charity and we couldn't be prouder!🙌🏽🏆‼️

Created in 2016, the Fiesta Bowl Charities Wishes for Teachers, powered by DriveTime program grants classroom wishes to teachers across the state of Arizona. Teachers enter and share the wish for the classroom. Winners are selected by a random drawing to receive a $5,000 grant. All wish recipients are invited to walk in the Desert Financial Fiesta Bowl Parade and be recognized on-field at the Cheez-It® Bowl!

🤩🥳🌟𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗰𝗸 𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗸 𝗯𝗲𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗽 𝘂𝘀 𝗰𝗲𝗹𝗲𝗯𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵 𝗼𝗳 𝗼𝘂𝗿 #𝗲𝘅𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝐃𝐕𝐔𝐒𝐃 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝐰𝐡𝐨 𝐰𝐨𝐧 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝘄𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝐟𝐞𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐝 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐲𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐬 𝐅𝐢𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐚 Bowl PARADE & 𝐂𝐡𝐞𝐞𝐳-𝐢𝐭 𝐁𝐨𝐰𝐥! 🤩🌟🥳

‼️‼️Congratulations
Paige Stewart
Robert Lane
Sajan Mathew
Stella Peper

For more information about the Fiesta Bowl or about view times go here: https://www.fiestabowl.org/sports/2019/10/23/wishes-for-teachers-recipients.aspx

post_text:
🤩Are you tuning in to today's Fiesta Bowl Parade at 9am on Channel 3?🏆

If so, make sure to help us celebrate the 14 DVUSD teachers who won the "Wishes for Teachers" Fiesta Bowl Charity!🙌🏽

Created in 2016, the Fiesta Bowl Charities Wishes for Teachers, powered by DriveTime program grants classroom wishes to teachers across the state of Arizona. Teachers enter and share the wish for the classroom. Winners are selected by a random drawing to receive a $5,000 grant. All wish recipients are invited to walk in the Desert Financial Fiesta Bowl Parade and be recognized on-field at the Cheez-It® Bowl!

🤩🥳🌟𝐖𝐚𝐭𝐜𝐡 TODAY 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐩 𝐮𝐬 𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐨𝐧 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐬𝐮𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭 𝐨𝐮𝐫 #𝗲𝘅𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝐃𝐕𝐔𝐒𝐃 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝐰𝐡𝐨 𝐰𝐨𝐧 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐛𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐝 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐲𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐬 𝐅𝐢𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐚 𝐁𝐨𝐰𝐥 PARADE! 🤩🌟🥳

This week, we celebrate our winning teachers... Today we send
‼️‼️Congratulations to:
Jennifer Hesse
Keri Chavarria
Matthew Laskin
Meagan Veraldi

For more information about the Fiesta Bowl or about view times go here: https://www.fiestabowl.org/sports/2019/10/23/wishes-for-teachers-recipients.aspx

🤩🥳🌟𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗸𝗲𝗲𝗽 𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝘆𝗲 𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝐨𝐧 𝐃𝐞𝐜𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐞𝐫 𝟐𝟖𝐭𝐡 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗼𝘂𝗿 #𝗲𝘅𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝐃𝐕𝐔𝐒𝐃 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝐰𝐡𝐨 𝐰𝐨𝐧 and will be featured in this years 𝐅𝐢𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐚 𝐁𝐨𝐰𝐥 PARADE! 🤩🌟🥳

post_text:
𝗪𝗼𝘄! 𝗪𝗲 𝗱𝗶𝗱 𝗶𝘁! Today is our last and final day of our celebrated '24 Days of A's!'

🤩🥳Congratulations to all the previously recognized schools, and a BIG congrats to our last "A" rated school: 𝗪𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗪𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹🤩🥳

This #Extraordinary school is one of 24 DVUSD schools rated as an “A” by ADE!

West Wing School is nestled within the scenery of Mountains and sits near the tip of Northwest Peoria. The beautifully poignant atmosphere cradles the crux of the school, and serves as an organic exhibition system in which students are offered organic 'hello's' from the hallways as they walk to class. 🌄

Not only is West Wing alarmingly beautiful, but it also offers a diverse and multifaceted set of academic programs such as all-inclusive gifted programs and advanced HS courses taught at the middle school level.

✨‼️✨Along with being an "A" rated school, West Wing has also been rewarded with the A+ Arizona Educational Foundation School of Excellence Honor (in 2018), and the Principle of the year Award (in 2016).

Follow @westwingschool on Twitter to stay connected with all their events and updates!

Today is 𝗦𝗶𝗲𝗿𝗿𝗮 𝗩𝗲𝗿𝗱𝗲 𝗦𝗧𝗘𝗔𝗠 𝗔𝗰𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗺𝘆'𝘀 𝗱𝗮𝘆... as we continue to celebrate the 24 #extraordinary DVUSD schools that are rated as an “A” school!

‼️✨We are celebrating each "A" school over 24 Days... for 24 Days of A's!📚‼️

🥳🤩Sierra Verde is the only school in DVUSD to be a STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, and Math) Academy. Through the application of STEAM, students are learning and working toward how to answer the following: ‘How do we conserve at Sierra Verde?’ Each grade takes this question and enlists it to explore the many conservable resources such as energy, and the impact of a student’s environmental footprint on campus.

They have also had many Student Athletes of the Year, teachers who have won grants, DVEF Battle of the Books District Champions, and many Math league Competition winners!

Congrats Sierra Verde on your "A" rating!

🤩🥳Today we honor 𝗦𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗿𝗮 𝗗𝗮𝘆 𝗢’𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 as part of our "24 Days of A's" in which we celebrate each of the 24 #extraordinary DVUSD schools that have been rated as an “A” school by ADE!🤩🥳

✨Sandra Day strives to provide students with a college prepatory institution that integrates college readiness in a technology rich classroom. ✨
SDOC is also highly esteemed for their award-winning programs in Dance, Choir, Band, Marching Band, Theater, and Advanced Placement Studio Arts programs in Drawing and Ceramics. 📔📚

Sandra Day O’Connor HS also offers several other programs and partnerships that provide students the space to grow and evolve into their own. For instance, the Partnership with the Gilder Lehrman Institute offers students the opportunity to enroll into a four-year advanced program with The Academy of American Studies.

Congratulations Sandra Day O’Connor on this big achievement!

🎉As part of our “24 Days of A’s" celebration, we are honoring each of this year’s 24 #extraordinary DVUSD schools that have been rated as “A” schools! 🎉

💯📣𝗧𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝘄𝗲 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗡𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗿𝗮 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝘆𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹!

✍🏽👨🏽‍🏫Along with maintaining their “A” rating for two years, Norterra Canyon has also been recognized for their many communal achievements, including the highest scale scores among students in the AzMerit Assessments.

Norterra also offers Professional Learning Communities (PLC’s) that serve to provide a systematic means of improving instruction and school culture, and gives our schools a framework for improved student learning.

‼️Congratulations Norterra Canyon School! You’re truly #extraordinary!

Want to stay updated with events and school information? Check out Norterra Canyon's Twitter: @NorterraCanyon or go to: https://www.dvusd.org/Domain/119

🦋𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗻 𝗥𝗶𝗱𝗴𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗶𝘀 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗳𝗲𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆'𝘀 "𝟮𝟰 𝗗𝗮𝘆𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗔'𝘀" 𝗮𝘀 𝘄𝗲 𝗵𝗼𝗻𝗼𝗿 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝟮𝟰 #𝗲𝘅𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝗗𝗩𝗨𝗦𝗗 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀 𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘀 𝗮𝗻 “𝗔” 𝗯𝘆 𝗔𝗗𝗘!🌵

🎊Mountain Ridge High School does more than just provide students with high academic standards, specialized activities and technology; they are also home to many Emmy Winners, Sport State CHampions, ACT & SAT perfect scores, and so much more! 🎊

🏆This year, several Mountain Ridge students were honored at the Arizona DECA State Conference for their administrative abilities and effective management skills. DECA aims to prepare emerging leaders and entrepreneurs in marketing, finance, hospitality, and management in high schools and colleges around the globe.🎈

🌼Congratulations Mountain Ridge High School on your "A" rating! You're extraordinary!🌼📔

🖍Check them out on Twitter too! (@TheMRHS).
To learn more about this #extraordinary school go to: https://www.dvusd.org/mrhs

★𝐎𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝟏𝟒𝐭𝐡 𝐃𝐚𝐲 𝐨𝐟 "𝟐𝟒 𝐃𝐚𝐲𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐀'𝐬" 𝐰𝐞 𝐜𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐛𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐋𝐞𝐠𝐞𝐧𝐝 𝐒𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐬 𝐄𝐥𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐫𝐲 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥!★

👌This #Extraordinary school is one of 24 DVUSD schools rated as an “A” by ADE, but it is truly one of a kind!👌

Not only has Legend Springs maintained their 'A+ School of Excellence rating for three consecutive years, but they have also achieved great success in their Proficiency Scores - which are the HIGHEST in the District.

⚡Along with STEAM, Legend Springs also supplies students with a 1:1 technology plan which implements specialized technical processes such as Engineering Design and computer coding. Students also have access to a set of diverse clubs, and programs. ‘All Things E.Q.’ for instance, is a social emotional program that transforms positive school culture and prepares students to achieve academic success in school.👩‍🔬👨‍🔬

Congratulations Legend Springs on your "A" rating!

For more information about The Social Emotional Program at Legend Springs, Visit: legendsprings.dvusd.org and check out ‘All Things E.Q.’ OR follow their Twitter @LegendSprings

post_text:
🎉Today marks day 13 in our 24-day celebration of 24 #extraordinary DVUSD schools that are rated as an “A” school!🎉

Congratulations Las Brisas Elementary for your "A" rating!

✨Las Brisas (i.e. Spanish for "the breezes") is a K-6 elementary school that features intensive staff development in teaching literacy and mathematics with a child centered focus. Classrooms have student computers, SmartBoards, document cameras, and LCD projectors. A computer lab offers students training in the fundamentals of information technology. Mobile Labs are available for classroom use.✨

In addition, regular concerts, carnivals, and other school activities offer parents the opportunity to visit the school and observe the educational progress of their children.

◦Multiple laptop and Chromebook carts

◦School and State Science Fair
◦Full Musical, Grades 1-6
◦Computer Science class
◦Middle School: Passion Fridays
◦High School Credit
◦SAGE & Gifted Cluster Programs

post_text:
For over 24 days, we have been celebrating 24 #extraordinary schools that have been recognized as an "A" School from the Arizona Department of Education.

𝐓𝐨𝐝𝐚𝐲'𝐬 𝐡𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐢𝐬 𝐆𝐚𝐯𝐢𝐥𝐚𝐧 𝐏𝐞𝐚𝐤 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥!

🎖Gavilan Peak provides advanced academic achievement for gifted and honors students, fine arts showcases with their Spring Musical, ACE Assemblies, band, piano lab, chorus and International Dance teams, championship sports as part of their winning history, and 21st Century skills in problem-based learning, world language in our Mandarin Project and advanced technology.🎖

🔥They also partner with schools in China, Taiwan, Uganda and Brazil to build bridges of learning, understanding and communication.🎉

Discover more about this amazing school on their Twitter (@GavilanPeak_GLA) and their website: https://www.dvusd.org/gavilanpeak

post_text:
𝐒𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐍𝐞𝐞𝐝𝐬 𝐁𝐮𝐬 𝐃𝐫𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐘𝐞𝐚𝐫 𝟐𝟎𝟏𝟗 – 𝐒𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐲 𝐂𝐮𝐫𝐥𝐞𝐲-𝐒𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐦🥳🤩

Sherry Curley-Scrum recently received the Arizona Association of Pupil Transportation’s Special Needs Bus Driver of the Year award. Sherry was nominated because of her continuous positive attitude and her willingness to find solutions. No matter the circumstance, Sherry focuses the needs of her students first, ensuring that they always get to school and back home safely.🌟🙌🏽

A parent recently called Transportation to thank Sherry’s supervisor for hiring her and her Bus Tech Tammy Hall. The parent was thrilled about Sherry and Tammy’s influence on the kids and how hard they work to make the rides to and from school the best they can be. The parent, said these two work hard every day to make her child’s ride enjoyable, which in turn makes the student love going to school. Sherry and Tammy truly make a difference in every student’s day!

Congratulations Sherry Curley-Scrum, Arizona Special Needs Driver of 2019!

🎉Desert Sky Middle is our featured school for today's "24 Days of A's." Today is day 8 in our continued celebration of our 24 #extraordinary DVUSD schools rated as an “A” by ADE!🎉

Desert Sky Middle is committed to preparing students for college and real world careers by applying what they are studying in the classroom to real-life situations and experiences.

Desert Sky also offers a wide array of Enrichment and Academic opportunities, all of which range from fine-arts programs to technology courses.

Congratulations on your "A" rating Desert Sky Middle!‼️

🎉𝐎𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 7th 𝐃𝐚𝐲 𝐨𝐟 "𝟐𝟒 𝐃𝐚𝐲𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐀'𝐬" 𝐰𝐞 𝐜𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐛𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 Desert Sage Elementary!

✨🎈Not only has Desert Sage served our students through consistent support and development, but they've also upheld their "A" rating for three consecutive years! They are one of few schools that offers a specialized Mandarin Immersion Program. ✨🎈

As exemplified in their Mission statement, Desert Sage seeks to “create a world class, fully articulated Mandarin Chinese language curriculum from Pre-K to the University which will enhance the future success of students in a global and technologically advanced society.”

‼️Desert Sage has also represented great significance and influence in the minds of our students. Mrs. Garrett & Mrs. Messina have demonstrated two years of the highest AzMerit Assessment growth in the District. This continued guidance has allowed students to receive perfect scores in both Math and ELA Assessments.

Learn more about this #extraordinary school on their website: https://www.dvusd.org/desertsage

✨On day four of our "24 Day's of A's" celebration, we are highlighting 𝐂𝐚𝐧𝐲𝐨𝐧 𝐒𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐬 𝐒𝐓𝐄𝐌 𝐀𝐜𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐦𝐲! ✨

Not only is Canyon Springs recognized as one of the 24 DVUSD #Extraordinary schools that have been rated with an “A”, but they've also consecutively upheld their "A" rating for three years straight!!

Canyon Springs is an Academy accredited for their AdvancED STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) Certification.
Along with receiving ‘Teacher of the Year’ award, Canyon Springs also celebrated students who achieved perfect scores on the 2018 ELA and Math tests.

Congratulations 𝐂𝐚𝐧𝐲𝐨𝐧 𝐒𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐬 𝐒𝐓𝐄𝐌 𝐀𝐜𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐦𝐲!! You're extraordinary!

post_text:
Congrats to Barry Goldwater High School's Teacher and Chef Ryan Mattheis!

Experienced chef and culinary arts teacher in Phoenix wins Silver Apple award:
https://www.azfamily.com/community/silver_apple_award/experienced-chef-and-culinary-arts-teacher-in-phoenix-wins-silver/article_5246891a-112b-11ea-ac0e-a79aca1ba18b.html

From one of his students:
“Chef Mattheis has been instrumental in not only helping myself succeed in all that I do but every one of my classmates as well. He stays after school to help us succeed in our student run restaurant Avenue 27, which he started and runs without any other teacher's help and sometimes without extra pay. He always puts every student above himself, even if they aren't truly his students.”

post_text:
🎼🎸🎖The Arizona Band and Orchestra Directors Association’s ‘William E. Richardson’ Award recognizes High School Band and Orchestra programs that exhibit a high level of achievement in all areas of a given school year.🥁🎷

The program must score a Superior or Superior with Distinction rating at ALL of the ABODA Festivals within a school year: The State Marching Festival, Area Concert Festival, Area Jazz Festival, State Concert Festival, and State Jazz Festival. In addition, these programs must exhibit successful student participation at the AMEA solo and Ensemble Festival and program presentation at the AMEA All-State Band Orchestra.

👉🏽Director Aaron Vogel and the Mountain Ridge High School Band were selected for this exceptional honor for the third year in a row!

🏆⭐️✨Congratulations 🎉🙌🏻⭐️to Director Aaron Vogel and the Mountain Ridge High School Band!

post_text:
🙌🏻👉Congrats to Heather Mock for being selected for the ASBO Certificate of Excellence!

For more than 40 years, the Certificate of Excellence in Financial Reporting has honored school districts for excellence and best Practices. Heather Mock, DVUSD Director of Finance, and her team received the Certificate of Excellence in Financial Reporting Award for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2018.

✨This award which was presented by the Arizona Association of School Business Officials, represents a significant achievement and reflects their commitment to the highest standards of school system financial reporting.

🎉Congratulations to Heather Mock and the DVUSD Finance Department on their Certificate of Excellence in Financial Reporting!

🎼The National Association for Music Education recently selected members for their All-National Concert Bands. The students chosen represent the top performing high school musicians in the United States. 🎹

👉Congratulations to Darryl Leung, a junior and saxophone player from Mountain Ridge High School, who was recently selected for the 2018-19 NAFME All-National Concert Band!!

Darryl has been playing the saxophone since fifth-grade and continually illustrates his talent through his many #Extraordinary accomplishments. Along with obtaining first chair sax player as a sophomore, he has also become a two-time member of All-State Band.

Congrats Darryl!

post_text:
DVUSD Director of Community Education Barb Ervin and the Community Education Department were selected as 2018-2019 Arizona Family and Consumer Sciences Education (FACS) Ed Business Partner of the Year!!

FACS is a non-profit organization with a mission to provide opportunities for students. Community Education has proven to be a vital resource for DVUSD’s CTE Early Childhood Education Programs. Students are given the opportunity to come into the Community Education preschools to develop practical skills in teaching and working among children. Community Ed also hosts student interns across the district, granting them additional education skills as well as future employment prospects.

🙌🏻Congratulations to Barb Ervin and the Community Education Department -- the FACS Business Partner of the Year!🙌🏻

post_text:
All ballots from Tuesday's Election have been counted. The DVUSD Bond and M&O Override have passed. Below is a message from Superintendent Dr. Curtis Finch:

“We are extremely thankful to the voters in our community for their continued support and commitment to the students of Deer Valley.

We are pleased that voters understood the need for this funding, which will provide building improvements on all DVUSD campuses, allow DVUSD to maintain class sizes, attract and retain teachers and staff, continue to provide a dedicated funding source for free full-day kindergarten, and support programs like fine arts, Physical Education, gifted services, Language Immersion, International Baccalaureate, and more.

This yes vote will allow Deer Valley Unified School District to continue fulfilling our mission of providing extraordinary educational opportunities for every learner.”
Curt
text:

“We are extremely thankful to the voters in our community for their continued support and commitment to the students of Deer Valley.

We are pleased that voters understood the need for this funding, which will provide building improvements on all DVUSD campuses, allow DVUSD to maintain class sizes, attract and retain teachers and staff, continue to provide a dedicated funding source for free full-day kindergarten, and support programs like fine arts, Physical Education, gifted services, Language Immersion, International Baccalaureate, and more.

This yes vote will allow Deer Valley Unified School District to continue fulfilling our mission of providing extraordinary educational opportunities for every learner.”
Curt

post_text:
You have TWO more days to drop off your Ballot for the DVUSD M&O Override and Bond Election at a collection site to ensure it is received by Tuesday, November 5!

Collection Sites:
--DVUSD District Office: Monday and Tuesday from 8 am - 4:30 pm

--Constitution Elementary School: Monday from 8 am - 4 pm with EXTENDED HOURS TUESDAY NOV 5 from 6 am - 7 pm

The total cost of the M&O Override for homeowners is a CONTINUATION of $19.23 a month property tax on the average assessed home value.

The total cost of the Bond is $13.28 a month on average assessed home value. This funding is being structured to NOT INCREASE the projected tax rate.

More facts: www.dvusd.org/election
